EmailTemplate.name: Canada QBO Post Call Email
EmailTemplate.subject: Additional resources for your Quickbooks to help drive your business
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Request Completed {!Case.CaseNumber}
Dear {!Contact.Name},
Your Data Services request is now complete! Your repaired file is now available to be downloaded at your earliest convenience.
Before you download your file, please read the following:
1. There were two files uploaded by the Data Services representative:
*Your repaired company file in one of the following formats:
* Quickbooks Pro/Premier and Enterprise Solutions: Your company file as [Outgoing File Name].QBM (QBM is a portable, or compressed, copy of your file). * QuickBooks Mac: Your company file as [Outgoing File Name].qb201# (.qb201# where #### is the version of QuickBooks your file is returned in for example .qb2016). * QuickBooks Point of Sale: Your company file as [Outgoing File Name].QPB (QPB is a backup copy of your file).
* A ReadMe.doc file with the following information:
* How to restore the company file to be your new working file. * Any details on what was fixed in your file or deleted transactions you will have to re- enter.
2. The company Admin Password has been changed.
* The password should be the letter A plus your Customer Account Number (CAN). For example: A123465789. * Intuit recommends changing the Admin password as soon as you have restored your company file.
3. Any transactions entered in your current file will need to be re-entered in the repair file.
4. If you were able to work in your company file while data services was fixing a copy, you are responsible for re-entering this information into your repaired file.
5. Merging company files or transactions cannot be done by Intuit.
6. Chat Live! with us if you have any questions or issues regarding the resolution of your company file. Your case will be closed 72 hours from this email.
Ready to download your repaired file?
1. Click the following link http://intuitb2b.force.com/FileExchange (If the link doesn't work, copy and paste it into your browser's address bar).
2. Enter the credentials and click the I have read and agree to the Terms of Service checkbox.
3. Click Sign In.
4. In the File Uploaded By Intuit section, in the Action column, click the cloud with arrow pointing down icon.
5. Browse to the location where you want to save the file and click Save.
6. Refer to Readme.doc for steps to restore portable company file and other information relating to your case.
New with Data Services!
* Visit the Data Services Case Status Information page to get the latest updates with your company file, if you lost your File Transfer PIN, or QuickBooks Password. * Communicate with the agent assigned to your case without having to leave a voicemail or send an separate email. * Chat Live! with a Data Services Specialist to check the status of your case or ask questions regarding your case.
Thank you, Intuit Data Services
This is an automated email. Please do not reply directly as you will not receive a response.
